lines.text:
[Pointing to something in the water beyond the ship]
I wonder what that is?

[Excitedly]
What? What? Where?
There, floating...
Oh, that's, uh, that's just some flotsam, or jetsam. Whatever the difference is.
Well, flotsam is something from a shipwreck, and jetsam is something thrown overboard in order to lighten the ship.
Oh... I guess that makes me flotsam, then.
And apparently my brother considers me jetsam.
That must've been some kind of mistake.
Oh, Johnny and I were never exactly close. When I was nine, he tried to sell me to a steamer captain. I guess it comes from living in the islands.
I don't know, there's a lot here that doesn't add up.
Having trouble balancing the ledgers, Number One? Why don't you just forget about clerking...

[exasperated]
I *told* you, I'm not a "clerk," I'm a C.P.A. And anyway, even an office boy can see that something's wrong here. For instance, why do you drink so much and not get drunk? And how come you don't eat? Or sleep? And why is your uniform so clean?
Really, Number One, I don't know what to make of this outburst. I only attribute it to that tumble you took... Miss Winslow, please, have another look at Number One's head.
Yes, how does it feel?
There's nothing wrong with my head!
Why don't you answer my questions?
What questions? Why do I drink and not get drunk? Because I am a healthy British officer.
Why do I not eat Oglethorpe's food? Because I wish to *remain* a healthy British officer.
Why do I require little sleep? Because I have mastered the Indian art of control over mind and body.
And why is my uniform always clean? Because I choose to keep it that way.
Does that settle the accounts for you, Number One?
How does your head feel?
Fine! I wish you'd stop asking me that every time I tell you what I saw.
Sorry.

Look, I don't mean to sound angry, it's just... He's right about me, you know. I get very upset when things don't add up. I mean, I once spent three days on an account because there was an error of 8 cents. So you can see how something like this would annoy me. I mean, why does he never leave the bridge?
Attack a cruiser? With what?

[digs out a bundle of dynamite from under some deck boards]
Saving that for just the proper occasion. Mind you, it's not going to be easy. We'll have to surprise her. Maneuver in close, aim amidships for the engines. Trust me to do that.
But even if we could get close enough to... I mean, I mean - then what? A cruiser, with all those guns... she'd sink us like a stone.

There are worse things than dying in the service of one's country, Number One. The Japanese rather prize it. And I must say, after 28 years in this bloody ship, I could do with a little eternal rest myself.
You're inhuman!
Aha! At last you've got a grasp of the matter, Number One.

[referring to Cmdr. Finchhaven]
He's dead, huh? I knew there was something fishy about him.
Well, my lovebirds, we're in the picture. It's them or us. Are you going below to man the engines? Or would you prefer to be blown apart without a chance?
That's a terrific choice.

[ponders for a moment]
Okay! We'll man the engines! Why not? A certified public accountant and a lady garage owner heroically attempt to sink a Japanese cruiser. I hope the President will be very pleased!
